page.title: 12PLACES OF INTEREST
page.content: This part of the Mendips is a good holiday centre for visiting many interesting places such as Bath and Bristol. In the immediate locality the following places are worth a visit. {Chewton Mendip:} This famous peal of eight, reputedly amongst the finest in Britian, is popular with camponologists the world over. The cheese dairy is also well worth a visit to see traditional farmhouse cheddar being made. {Wells:} The cathedral with its famous West Front and a wonderful clock with the oldest face in the world is well worth a visit. {Glastonbury:} The ruins of Glastonbury Abbey are interesting and legend has it that King Arthur is buried there. The Rural Life Museum is enclosed in a superb Great Barn, this museum is an essential visit.
